intro: Neltuma glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular neltuma, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, often pink or purple flowers. It typically grows in moist, tropical or subtropical environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
